TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1602
TEI.2.document_title: James Hope to J. E. B. Austin, 02-16-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: James Hope to J. E. B. Austin, February 16, 1827. Asking for garden seed from Mexico.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1602

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*James Hope to J. E. B. Austin, February 16, 1827. Asking for garden seed from Mexico.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*date_mentioned n="02-16-1827">Feby 16,1827*/date_mentioned*
*p*Dr SIR*/p*
*p*I understand that you have brought a few Garden and other seeds from the *location_mentioned*Interior*/location_mentioned*—I should be happy if you could spare me a few of them, and should I be fortunate with them I will replace them again, or any other seeds that I have you can get with pleasure— please send them down by *person_mentioned*Capt Chriesman*/person_mentioned* when he comes down.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James Hope*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr-Brown Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
